Description: A tall jar of red pottery: with an external roll-rim. The sides expand from the rim to the shoulder, then converge to a narrow, rounded base. Between the rim and the shoulder there is a raised ridge. The side of the jar bears an incised inscription, consisting of two signs. Good condition.
Curator's comments: This jar came to the Museum together with a number of seals of Den; see 1897,0112.21, 1897,0112.23 and 1897,0112.25. For the mark, cf. W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' I, pls. XXXIX, 5 LVI, 1094-8. Bibliography: 'Sacred Food' (Barcelona, 2001): 189 No 56.
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1996 11 Jul-6 Oct, Japan, Arita, Kyushu Ceramic Museum, Ceramics and Civilisation 2001 30 Jun-30 Sep, Barcelona, Sacred Food
